utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Time. Alright Klingons, pencils down.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, I have pokh.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Have it. Got it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Potl.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Yup. Have it. Have it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Pukhpa.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Have it. Got it. Yup.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I have Chorrr.

utterance.speaker: Raj _ Sheldon
utterance.content: Got it. Yup.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Nekhmakh.

utterance.speaker: Raj _ Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And Kreplach.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hold on a second. Kreplach?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That isn’t Klingon, it’s Yiddish for meat-filled dumpling.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, as it turns out, it’s also a Klingon word.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really? Define it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Kreplach, A hearty Klingon… dumpling.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Judge’s ruling?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Bilurrrbe.

utterance.speaker: Penny (entering)
utterance.content: Hey, guys, I need to use your TV.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What’s wrong with your TV?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t know, it just died, I’m getting a bunch of static.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Did you pay your cable bill?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You sound just like the cable company. All right, so, shh, Tyra Banks is about to kick someone off America’s Next Top Model.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excuse me, Penny, but we’re…

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, no, don’t tell her.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: …playing Klingon Boggle.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Aw!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What do you mean, aw? Like she didn’t know we were nerds?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, if you must watch, then mute it with closed captions, please.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, Boggle warriors, kapla’!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Look at those women.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: They’re gorgeous.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh! Worf, nice! Too bad that’s a proper noun.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, look, the’s the future Mrs. Wolowitz. No, wait, that’s the future Mrs. Wolowitz. With her head in the lap of, what a coincidence. It’s the future Mrs. Wolowitz.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, and they can all move in with you and your mother, the current Mrs. Wolowitz.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Is qochbe’ spelled with a or a ?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Why is that Mrs. Wolowitz crying?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh. That’s Anais, none of the other girls in the house like her.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: House? What house?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: They all live in a house together.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: A house, where?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t know. Somewhere in L.A.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Wait a minute, you’re telling me that I’m within driving distance of a house filled with aspiring supermodels?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, I guess.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And they live together and shower together and have naked pillow fights?

utterance.speaker: Leonard (to Penny who has got up to leave)
utterance.content: Hey, wh-where are you going?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: To pay my cable bill.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, pencils down! I have lokh, makh, and cherrrkh. Anybody got those?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Did I miss anything? Did they kick Giselle off?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Not yet, but her underwater photo shoot was an embarrassment.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sadly, Mrs. Giselle Wolowitz is sensitive to chlorine. Lucky for her I like my fashion models pruny and bug-eyed.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, the food’s here.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: There’s the house, freeze frame, freeze frame.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Marking the star positions and physical landmarks so we can find the house of the supermodels.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Isn’t it obvious? Every week, they kick out a beautiful girl, making her feel unwanted and without self-esteem, a.k.a. the future Mrs. Howard Wolowitz.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Is my hamburger medium well?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Dill slices, not sweet?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Individual relish packets?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Onion rings?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Extra breading?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I asked.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What did they say?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Did you protest?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Vociferously?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, then what took you so long?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Just eat.

utterance.speaker: Penny (entering)
utterance.content: Hey, guys, what’d I miss? What’d I miss?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Giselle’s hanging by a thread.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, good, I hate her.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Then you’re not invited to our wedding.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Here you go.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, do we have to suffer through this transparently manipulative pseudo-reality again?

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You and I have a standing TV schedule which is the result of extensive debate and compromise. Any alterations except for breaking news have to be pre-approved at the weekly roommate meeting.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Put it on the agenda.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But you have to make a motion to put it on agenda.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, I’ll make a motion, but you’re not going to like it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fine. Mock Parliamentary procedure. At least put it on mute.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, Giselle’s not getting kicked off. It’s totally going to be Summer. What?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon’s onion ring. Just put it back!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s one onion ring.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Just put it back before he comes!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, no, no, no, I don’t think that’s where it was.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, here he comes, deny, deny, people, wall of silence.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Who touched my…

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Penny! Penny did it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why would you do that?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t know. I was hungry? What’s the big deal?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The big deal is that nobody touches food on my plate.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right. Look, I didn’t know, I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I’m sorry, but that is your second strike.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You have two strikes. Three strikes and you’re out. It’s a sports metaphor.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: A sports metaphor?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, baseball.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, yeah, I’ll play along. What was my first strike?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: March 18th. You violated my rule about forwarding email humour.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I did?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The photo of the cat who wants to “has cheezburger”?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, come on, everybody loves LOLcats. They’re cute and they can’t spell ’cause they’re cats.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I trusted you with my email address, and you betrayed that trust by sending me Internet banality, strike one. Touching my food, strike two.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Don’t worry. They only stay on your record for a year.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You can get them removed early, but you have to take his class.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Come on, I touched one onion ring.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And then you put it back, compromising the integrity of all the other onion rings.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, honey, the buses don’t go where you live, do they?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Look, Penny, I wish I could be more lenient with you, but since you’ve become a permanent member of our social group I have to hold you to the same standards as everybody else.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Congratulations. You’re officially one of us.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: One of us, one of us.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, what a thrill.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re sitting in my spot.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, jeez, you’ve got to be kidding me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, she’s in my spot.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah. Uh, see, here’s the thing, after you leave, I still have to live with him.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t care. I’m taking a stand. Metaphorically.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, that’s it. Strike three.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ooh, strike three.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m banished? What the hell kind of crap is that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Listen, don’t worry. I’ll talk to him.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, you do that.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Just so I know, would you be open to taking his class? You can do it online!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So based on our triangulation we’ve narrowed down the location of the top model house to three square miles in the Hollywood Hills.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Or possibly Durham, North Carolina.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: When we find it, you want to go with us?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: To do what?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Party with the pretty girls, dude!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Are you insane? You’re not going to party with them, you’re not even going to get anywhere near that place.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s what they said to Neil Armstrong about the moon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No one said anything of the kind to Neil Armstrong, the entire nation dedicated a decade of effort and treasure to put a man on the moon.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, my fellow Americans, before this year is out we will put a Wolowitz on one of America’s top models.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And a large number of people will believe it never happened.

utterance.speaker: Penny (arriving)
utterance.content: Okay, let me guess. A quesadilla with soy cheese for the lactose-intolerant Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Shrimp Caesar salad with no almonds for the highly allergic kosher-only-on-the-high-holidays Howard, and for our suddenly back on the Hindu wagon Raj, meatlover’s pizza, no meat. Coming right up.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wait. Excuse me. You forgot my barbecue bacon cheeseburger, barbecue sauce, bacon and cheese on the side.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, I didn’t tell you? You’re banished from the Cheesecake Factory.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, you have three strikes. One, coming in. Two, sitting down. And three, I don’t like your attitude.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You can’t do that. Not only is it a violation of California state law, it flies directly in the face of Cheesecake Factory policy.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, no, there’s a new policy. No shoes, no shirt, no Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I bet we could sell that sign all over Pasadena.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Penny, can I talk to you for a minute? Hi.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Look, here’s the thing, um, I talked to Sheldon and he feels terrible and he agrees that he was unreasonable and out of line.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really? Well, that’s great.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, so just apologize to him, okay?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What? I’m not going to apologize to that nutcase.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, come on, it’s easy, he’ll even tell you what to say.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Leonard, don’t you get it? If you guys keep going along with his insanity, you’re just encouraging him.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We’re not encouraging. It’s more like knuckling under.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Look, I like hanging out with you guys, but I’m not going to apologize for something I didn’t do.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, actually, technically, you did do it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That’s strike one, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: There you go, quesadilla, salad, there’s your pizza, and thanks to Sheldon’s heated discussion with my manager one barbecue bacon cheeseburger, barbecue sauce, bacon and cheese on the side.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Go ahead, eat it. I dare you

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s it. There’s the house, I found America’s top models!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Look, on the roof, Anais and Giselle are sunbathing. European-style.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You can recognize people on Google Earth?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Of course not, I got a buddy of mine at NORAD to have a spy drone fly over.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: NORAD? You’re using military aircraft?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It was already targeted to poke around a nuclear reactor in Siberia, I took it an hour out of its way, tops.

utterance.speaker: Penny (entering, angry)
utterance.content: Okay, where is he?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon? I just dropped him off at the comic book store. Why?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Here. Try and go online.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Problem with the WiFi?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, just try.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (on screen)
utterance.content: Greetings, hamburger toucher. You are probably wondering why you cannot IM with your little friends about how much you heart various things. Well, this recorded message is alerting you that I am putting an end to your parasitic piggybacking upon our WiFi. If you want to remedy the situation you can contact the phone company, set up your own WiFi and pay for it, or you may apologize to me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I reiterate, knuckle under.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, no, no, no, no. It is on. I am gonna introduce your friend to a world of hurt.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, Penny, you don’t want to get into it with Sheldon. The guy is one lab accident away from being a supervillain.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t care, I was in junior rodeo, I can hogtie and castrate him in 60 seconds.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No need to neuter the nerd, I can get you back online.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: There, see? Problem solved.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Voila!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (voice from Howards laptop)
utterance.content: Hello, puny insects. As a consequence of your efforts to circumvent my will, everyone is awarded one additional strike.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thanks a lot, Howard.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What are you complaining about? I’m the one who has to take the class again.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh! Hello.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Time to do your laundry, huh?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s Saturday night. Saturday is laundry night.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I know. Every Saturday at 8:15, easy to anticipate.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What are you implying?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m implying that you’re a creature of habit, and if something were to prevent you from doing your laundry on Saturday at 8:15, you might find it unpleasant. Knuckle under, my ass.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, no, are all the machines taken? What are you gonna do?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No problem, I’ll just do my laundry another night.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Another night? Well, I guess you can try, but deep inside your heart you’ll know that laundry night is always Saturday night.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Woman, you are playing with forces beyond your ken.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, well, your ken can kiss my Barbie.

utterance.speaker: Penny (Knock, knock, knock)
utterance.content: Sheldon Sheldon Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Where are my clothes?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Your clothes?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes, I left them in the washers and when I went down to get them, they were gone.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Really? Despite the sign that says “Do not leave laundry unattended”?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, where are my clothes?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know, I do recall seeing some female undergarments. Where was that? Oh, yes, earlier this evening I happened to gaze out the window and a brassiere caught my eye. Do those look familiar?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: How the hell did you get them up on that telephone wire?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: When you understand the laws of physics, Penny, anything is possible. And may I add, mwah-ha-ha!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Get them down.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Apologize.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Never.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, then may I suggest you get a very long stick and play panty pinata.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Look, wait, Sheldon, this has gotten out of hand, okay? I’ve done some stupid things, you’ve done some stupid things, how about we just call it even and move on with our lives?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ve done no stupid things.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Look, you’ve got to meet me halfway here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I am meeting you halfway, I’m willing to concede that you’ve done some stupid things.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, you guys are talking again. Good. What happened?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Leonard, remember when I said it was on? Well, now it’s junior rodeo on.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, not junior rodeo. What did you do?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I had no choice, Leonard, she ruined laundry night.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (looking out of window)
utterance.content: A-a-a-aw!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Mwah-ha-ha.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Telephone wires can’t electrocute you, can they?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No. Look, this has to stop.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, no, no, no. It is just beginning.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: All right, I really didn’t want to do this, but… here.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What’s this?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon’s Kryptonite.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, my God.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: He can never know that I gave that to you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Look, I said I wanted to hurt him, but, but this?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’ll shorten the war by five years and save millions of lives.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, pause it. That’s it. Confirmed. We now have the address of the top model house.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: God bless you, Google Street View registered trademark.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, for the record what you’re doing is really creepy.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You know what? If it’s creepy to use the Internet, military satellites, and robot aircraft to find a house full of gorgeous young models so that I can drop in on them unexpectedly, then fine, I’m creepy.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (into phone, which has just rung)
utterance.content: Hello. Oh, hi. Yeah, hold on a second. I’ll get him. Sheldon, it’s for you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Who is it?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Your mother.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, good. Hi, Mom. How are you? But, Mom, she keeps sitting in my spot. And, and she touched my food. Okay, yes, I took her clothes, but she started it. No, that’s not fair. Why should I have to apologize? Yeah, I really don’t think this is the kind of thing Jesus concerns himself with. No, you’re right, I don’t really know what Jesus thinks about. All right, good-bye. Did you tell on me?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Are you kidding me? I already have two strikes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny, Penny, Penny… I am very, very sorry for what I have done. Here’s your laundry, I rescind your strikes and you are no longer banished.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Can I sit wherever I want? No, no, never mind, never mind, that’s, that’s not important. Sheldon, this was big of you. Thank you. I really appreciate it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Good night, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well played.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Just remember: with great power comes great responsibility.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Understood.

utterance.speaker: Model
utterance.content: Can I help you

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes, we here to fix the cable.

utterance.speaker: Model
utterance.content: I think we have satellite.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s what I meant.

utterance.speaker: Model
utterance.content: Oh. Okay, come on in.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: She’s taller than all the women in my family combined.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What do we do now?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Follow Mrs. Wolowitz.
